group_1.textCenter: Hello, you two!@Sorry for keeping you waiting!

group_1.textRight: Ah, Konomi, you're here!

group_1.textLeft: We've been wondering where you were!

group_1.textRight: I just sent an email about this
to Kokoro and the others who're making chocolate,
but you get to see it in person! Here's my design!

group_1.textLeft: Oh! Is that for our booth?
Well done, Konomi!

group_1.textRight: Thank you!
Since the flower shop owner@agreed to work with Walnut's,
I really wanted to live up to your expectations!

group_1.textLeft: How did Kokoro and the others react?

group_1.textRight: They were thrilled when they saw the design.

group_1.textLeft: Then this shall be our blueprint for the shop!

group_1.textRight: I guess that just leaves our advertising flyers.
Unfortunately, we still haven't decided on a layout...

group_1.textLeft: Mmm...that's right.
It has to be something that both adults@and children can easily grasp, but...
[chara:101350:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]*Gasp*

group_1.textRight: What's wrong?

group_1.textLeft: We can use calligraphy!
I've cultivated those skills since childhood―@I'll use them to write a resplendent message!

group_1.textRight: Wait, what exactly are you planning on writing?
And are you sure people will be able to read@it if you write it all fancy like that?

group_1.textLeft: [chara:101350:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What?!
It'll be perfectly easy to understand!

group_1.textRight: Erm...if you guys want a layout,@I'd be happy to sketch one out for you.

group_1.textLeft: Would you really?!

group_1.textRight: Absolutely!

group_1.textLeft: Wh-what a generous offer!

group_1.textRight: Since our goal is to get kids to come visit,
I feel like the flyer should be@oriented towards them.
But please let me know if you have a@particular demographic you're targeting.

group_1.textLeft: Well...there is one girl we've specifically invited.
She's an elementary schooler we met@at Emily's Counseling Room.
She lost her father a long time ago...
And her mother is very busy,@so she’s usually on her own.
She says she's doing well,@but I think she must be lonely.
That's why we invited her to come―@So we could do something for her.

group_1.textRight: ...I see, thank you.
Then I think we should do something@eye-catching and fun.
...Yeah, I think I've got it!

group_1.textLeft: Please do whatever inspires you!
Once you give us a layout, we'll produce copies
and plaster them all over the city!

group_1.textRight: Yeah!

group_1.textLeft: Hm?
Oh, you're all–?! You came early today!

group_1.textRight: Yes! We thought we'd help you@get things ready for practice.
Erm, "Master"...?

group_1.textLeft: Asuka's a licensed naginata instructor, you see.

group_1.textRight: Wow! That's amazing!
...Master, I apologize for eavesdropping, but...
...It sounds like...@You're advertising some kind of store?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, our plan is to do a chocolate giveaway@for kids at the charity bazaar,
so we're going to spread the word!

group_1.textRight: It's a publicity thing, huh...?
The more people you have, the better, right?
I'll help you!
Yes, me too!

group_1.textLeft: Thank you from the bottom of my heart, everyone!

group_1.textRight: ...You have a lot of fans, Asuka.

group_1.textLeft: Why do you look so surprised?!

group_1.textRight: And it's not even true, either!
It makes sense, given her personality!
She can be strict at times,@but she's also pretty soft, too.

group_1.textLeft: ...It doesn’t feel like you’re complimenting@me for some reason!
